bfx

Class Sequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • bfx.Sequence
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SequenceConstQual, SequenceQual

    public abstract class Sequence
extends Object
    Abstract base class for all sequence representations A sequence has the sequence text and quality values, both the text and qualities are represented as byte arrays. Sequence objects are immutables. This class hierarchy does not care about the symbols in the sequence, there is classes in package bfx.seqenc to deal with specific sequences (DNA, color-space DNA, etc).
    Author:
    Leonardo Varuzza

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sequence

        protected Sequence(String id,
        String comments)
        Constructs a empty sequence with ID and comments. Both arguments can not be null. Should be used by concrete implementations of this class.
        Parameters:
        id - Sequence unique ID
        comments - Extra comments about the sequence

      • Sequence

        protected Sequence(String header)
        Construct a empty Sequence with header. Splits the header between the ID and the comments using the static method parseHeader. Header can not be null. Should be used by concrete implementations of this class.
        Parameters:
        header -

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public String getId()
        The ID should be unique in a given sequence set. This field is equivalent of the first part of a fasta header
        Returns:
        Sequence ID

      • getComments

        public String getComments()
        Other comments about the sequence This is equivalent of the second part of the fasta header.
        Returns:

        public abstract byte[] getSeq()
        Get Sequence Text. The returned value should not be modified.
        Returns:

        Get Quality values The returned value should not be modified.
        Returns:
        byte[] with quality values.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • parseHeader

        public static String[] parseHeader(String header)
        Split the header between the ID and comments using the fasta convetion. For example, this header gi|224589808:41196312-41277500 Homo sapiens chromosome 17, GRCh37.p5 Primary Assembly will be splited into ["gi|224589808:41196312-41277500","Homo sapiens chromosome 17, GRCh37.p5 Primary Assembly"]
        Parameters:
        header - Sequence Header
        Returns:
        A String[2] with ID in the first element and comments in the second. If there not comments the second element will be a empty string.

      • digestSeq

        public String digestSeq(String algorithm)
                 throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Apply a Message Digest Algorithm (such MD5 or SHA-1) the sequence text and return a hexadecimal string representing the hash value.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - Name of the algorithm
        Returns:
        A string with the hexadecimal representation of the hash value
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • digestSeq

        public String digestSeq()
        Apply digestSeq using MD5 sum.
        Returns:
        A string with a hexadecimal representation of MD5 value.

      • digestQual

        public String digestQual(String algorithm)
                  throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Apply a Message Digest Algorithm (such MD5 or SHA-1) the quality values (the bytes, not the string representation) and return a hexadecimal string representing the hash value.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - Name of the algorithm
        Returns:
        A string with the hexadecimal representation of the hash value
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException
